title: Something like a monospaced Akzidenz-Grotesk Condensed Medium
content:
Hi!

I'm looking for a font that looks like Akzidenz-Grotesk Condensed Medium, but monospaced or with tabular lining (I need the numbers to align well when on multiple lines...).

Thanks! I appreciate it a lot!

Chris.
author: krissserz

comments.content: As far as I know, tabular lining figures are the default for AG.

The standard (BE) figures looks a bit misaligned: **[AG Std (Med Cond)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145509/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Akzidenz-Grotesk%20Std%20-%20Medium%20Condensed&fid=1737c9359d4c112e42fb1119a86f09ba&fsize=60&text=567890-Qlkjiopasdrstyiwi%20123456-Qpasdrlkjiostyiwi%20926783-Qpasdrlkjiostyiwi&wrap=2)**  
but the BQ series looks fine to me: **[AG BQ (Med Cond)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317145509/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Akzidenz-Grotesk%20BQ%20-%20MdCndAlt%20Medium&fid=adca220d2d6bcdb4e2a4eccc61ce0842&fsize=60&text=567890-Qlkjiopasdrstyiwi%20123456-Qpasdrlkjiostyiwi%20926783-Qpasdrlkjiostyiwi&wrap=2)**

PS: Maybe Ricardo is right and the Std is just an old version which happens to be misaligned
